H0.text: Tides keep the planets in orbit around the Sun.

H1.text: Gravity keeps the planets in orbit around the Sun.

H2.text: Electricity keeps the planets in orbit around the Sun.

H3.text: Magnetism is what keeps the planets in orbit around the Sun.

A4.text: Gravity is the law that every object with mass attracts every other object in the universe in proportion to each mass and inversely proportional to the square of the distance between them.

A5.text: Gravity becomes the most significant interaction between objects at the scale of astronomical bodies, and it determines the motion of satellites, planets, stars, galaxies, and even light.
